name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Bainbridge Island Suites

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone! I will always stay here when visiting the island. The bed was great,the room was quiet and very clean. The staff was very accommodating and personable. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay! The underground parking was great too!
reviews.title: Recommend this hotel highly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only complaint: NO POOL other than that the room was great, location was good, staff was nice.
reviews.title: great rooms
Pretty good
reviews.text: Nice room, a mini-suite with another TV in the bedroom. I like that. It was quiet and the front desk staff were fine. I like the lower level garage parking with security entry, sure wish they had that in Tacoma and Seattle !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No complaints.
reviews.title: Great stay!

likes.disliked: — I had broken foot...my room was top floor waaaaay in the back. A lot of walking, but minor. I should have requested a room closer.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We pulled into Bainbridge tired and ready to find a room. The front desk help was very friendly, our room very large, exceptionally clean with nice views nature out the window( we were on the back side of the hotel)

Great location and great hotel. My son and I were unable to find a room in Seattle and ended up staying on Bainbridge Island. We had a great time riding the Ferry to City. We loved the island and the hotel was great - great location - large room.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Great Room

reviews.text: This hotel was really nice at first glance, but as the night wore on it showed more annoying aspects. The room was quite large with a large kitchen area (though no sink), and large bathroom. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful (though the man at the desk seemed to have limited knowledgable about the area he did ask his manager for help). The downsides were that the walls were thin, they only had 1 bell cart for the entire hotel, their breakfast started late and was very limited, there was no desk in the room, and although they advertised wireless - you could only get it in the lobby. The parking was underground and small spaces, but did have security cameras.
reviews.title: Okay for the night

likes.disliked: — thin walls, no wireless access in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night and were very impressed. The suite was pretty big and very clean. Everything was very new. Parking was great. It's free, and they have an underground garage that they lock after dark. The hotel is located across the street from Safeway (a grocery store) and many small restaurants/cafes. We actually went to the Mexican restaurant for a quick lunch, and it was quite tasty. The only downfall for the hotel was the continental breakfast. They had the usual toast, donuts, cereal, and fruit, but it seemed a little skimpy. We didn't expect much to begin with though, so it was alright. All in all, a wonderful stay at a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms were beautiful, and the parking was free and secure
likes.disliked: — Continental breakfast, and there isn't wireless internet (but they do give you an ethernet cord for the room)

reviews.text: Nice hotel in a nice location. Very close to the ferry terminal and has a grocery store, banks and some places to eat right across the stree. Our room was clean and nice, and the bedroom was separated from the main room giving the feeling a suite type of set up. Both rooms had a TV and there was also a little refridgerator in the room.
reviews.title: very comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently returned from a long visit to the west sound peninsula area and decided to stay out of the Seattle City center on Bainbridge for the last couple of nights. We were not quite ready for the BIG city life yet, but we were very pleased with the accommodations we did find. The Bainbridge Island Suites was clean and comfortable. Located in the center of town and across the street from a shopping center. It was nice to have such a great hotel location. I do have an especially favorite thing to share with you all here at Tripadvisor that I must mention. I met the General Manager Linda Thurrott, who was most helpful when we expressed interest in the local casino for gaming, dinner and entertainment. Linda obviously had connections because she arranged to have the casino pick us up and drop us off. We even came "home" to the hotel with a couple extra bucks. After traveling the fantastic Pacific Northwest and seeing nature at it's best, it was fun to have a couple days to regroup and adjust back to city life thanks to the assistance of Linda, her staff and the nice room at the beautiful Bainbridge Island Suites. We are forever thankful to you Linda! Mark and Pauline - Surprise Arizona
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms - Excellent Management

reviews.text: The hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I have so many good and positive comments on this wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel!

reviews.text: I would like to compliment the front desk staff who were always friendly, helpful and professional. Bravo to the maintenance staff who keep this hotel in "brand new" condition. And a special thanks to the housekeeping staff who keep the hotel immaculate.
reviews.title: Immaculate - Excellent Staff - Never had a better value!

reviews.text: I had a room with a king size bed and a small kitchen. Because I was staying for one week, this was the most economical way to go. The kitchen included a microwave, two stove top burners, refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster, small dishwasher, sink and all the plates, silverware, etc. that you would need.
reviews.title: Welcome Rest Stop

reviews.text: My room had a couch, nice television and a desk. The bedroom was good size with a small television. Bathroom was roomy. The free Wi-Fi was another advantage.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
Pleasant stay
reviews.text: The free breakfast at the hotel is a great way to start your day. You can make waffles which are absolutely delicious. There is also coffee, juices, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal, milk, bread and pastry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had never visited the Bainbridge Island Suites by Best Western before. Rest assured, we WILL return!
reviews.title: Suites for the Sweet!

likes.liked: — The new and well maintained hotel rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a DELIGHTFUL stay thanks to the virtually new suites of the Bainbridge Island B. W. featuring ammenities of a MUCH MORE EXPENSIVE hotel. Then, add in the charming and restful environment made possible by being on an island removed from the big city hassle of Seattle and top this all off with a staff that truly does "whatever it takes" to ensure their guests enjoy their stay. Manager Ms. Linda Thurrott has truly put together an exemplary package that could serve as a model for many other hotels.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay

reviews.text: KUDOS to the entire staff and Ms. Thurrott on such a well-designed, maintained and beautifully kept hotel. We have already recommended this hotel to friends as we do to you. Take the short ferry ride from Seattle to a serene world where relaxation is the norm! ENJOY!
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel
Disabled, stay away, or feel humiliated!
reviews.text: Room was nice with a "suite" feel about it. The internet plug was by the bed and not in the area where the table and chairs were located so we had to have a really long ethernet cord strung across the room for net service. We had to bring our own fruit for the continental breakfast which was only marginal. Very good underground parking with a door that closes at night. Right across the street from a small strip mall with some restaurants. Not within walking distance of anything else.
Stayed one night in this hotel. Room was wonderful, one of the largest I have ever experienced (they are more suites than standard bedrooms).
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in a great location
